title: Harvesting the Potatoes + Plans for Fall Veges

subtasks: Clear potato plants from the bed
Identify potato variety (German Butterball)
Select and prepare compost for bed amendment
Direct seed brassicas into the prepared bed
Apply row cover for pest protection
Prepare compost and mulch for clay soil improvement
Plant garlic or onions if desired
Address weed management under apple trees
Plan for seed selection next year
Use a bedding fork to dig potatoes
Evaluate potato yield and quality
Discuss the planting method for successful potatoes
Consider factors affecting potato success (soil, sunlight)
Propose potato reseeding or volunteer potatoes

tasks.task: Crop rotation and horizontal gardening demonstration
subtasks: Transition from potatoes to brassicas in the same bed
Apply mulch and compost on apple tree areas
Plan for soil health improvement over time
Integrate woody debris (e.g., grapevine trimmings) into the garden
Discuss whitefly infestation and row cover benefits
Install row cover over direct-seeded brassicas
Evaluate the effectiveness of mulch in weed suppression
Prepare soil for direct seeding (carrots, brassicas)
Broadcast seed into the loosened soil
Cover seeds with appropriate mulch
Water or wait for rain to start germination
Consider future crops (melons, tomatoes) for next season
Note issues with existing plants (apple trees, grapevines)
Make a compost tea or regular compost application plan
Setup drip irrigation or watering system for garden beds
